any data governance program.

I will tell you that this
one specific piece of advice

So what is it?

What is it that that

And the problem is this.

It's making a business
case for data governance.
That's the problem.

between the wrong way and

It's how it's done.

This is the kind of

It's because what you're

They're both making a business case.

So the question comes up
a lot about, you know,
so how am I gonna show the value

of data governance over
time, what metrics?

And what I've seen many times
is there will be metrics

like number of attributes
cataloged, you know,
things like that, or a number
of data quality issues resolved,

or even trying to attach
some business value

directly to data quality
issues that are resolved.
And there's nothing wrong
with measuring all of those things.

However, the best way to
measure the value of the program
is to measure the contribution
that the data governance program makes
to one or more business initiatives.
Now, in truth, there's no sort of hard
and fast mathematical way to do this.

It's very difficult to

how it was necessary,
